ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about setting up a plan of action for myself and holding myself accountable to my goals. Also of course a lot about research and statistical analyses tools.

I was able to build a closer relationship with my research mentors and develop the skills necessary for conducting empirical research in psychology. In particular, I strengthened my skills working with statistical programs and analyzing these results, as well as thinking critically about findings and drawing a bigger picture representation of what they mean.

None I received little help with this whole thesis process from the head of the department. Thanks to my advisor and graduate students in the lab, I received a lot of support and help with the organization of my thesis, which was helpful. The psychology department needs to be improved drastically!
Scientific writing, knowledge of the research process, statistical analysis, empirical tool development, incorporating community input and qualitative data. Presenting original research
Conducting empirical research after previous time spent only helping out on ongoing projects
Conducting research (specifically thematic analysis for qualitative research) and writing up findings in a full length paper.
I was able to learn on my own using a mentor of my choice. I did independent research and wrote a paper.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: there has got to be a better way to conduct this course. there is absolutely no structure and all it does is create confusion, stress, and anxiety. i wish there had be at least some suggested deadlines to help us organize our projects better. also there is no real community that is built for psychology majors and so going through this unstructured process with no real support system in the major was really anxiety-inducing

I think the strength was my adviser. Having a good adviser could make or break your experience with writing a thesis.

I think this course could be improved by helping guide students about the process. It seemed really daunting starting the process but after having gone through it, it really is not that bad. I wish though that I had maybe an info session or some peer adviser who could have helped guide me through the process a bit more.
It would be great if we had any intermediate assignments or prompts or meetings - they could all be optional, but it would be nice to have some guidance and accountability throughout the process.
You need to be very disciplined and treat this as a priority, but you get to study questions that you are truly interested in
I could lead my own project and had the support of my advisors.
The strength and weakness are the same: it's excellent to have the freedom to make your own schedule, but I do think that some structured work time or deadlines would be helpful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes, as it is necessary for a B.S. in psychology. it's also just a great way to get involved in carrying through your own research
Yes if you are a psychology major interested in empirical research
